sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Welcome to Unit 114 of our English learning journey. In this unit, we'll explore the usage of 'in case' to express precaution, preparation, or the possibility of a future event.

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: Understanding how to use this expression will enhance your ability to communicate intentions and actions. Let's delve into the key concepts.

sections.title: Introduction to 'In Case'
sections.content: Define the usage of 'in case' to indicate a precautionary measure or preparation for a possible future event
points: Take an umbrella with you in case it rains.
I'll bring some snacks in case we get hungry.

sections.title: Preposition 'In'
sections.content: Discuss the role of the preposition 'in' in the expression and its connection to time or circumstances.
points: We should leave early in case there's traffic
I'll write down the address in case I forget.

sections.title: Examples
sections.content: Let's examine examples to illustrate the application of 'in case'
points: Bring your charger in case your phone battery runs out
I'll pack an extra jacket in case it gets cold
She carries a first aid kit in case of emergencies

sections.title: Usage and Content
sections.content: Understand the appropriate contexts for using 'in case' and how it contributes to the overall meaning of a sentence.

sections.title: Recap and Summary:
sections.content: In summary, mastering the use of 'in case' allows you to express foresight and preparedness in various situations.

sections.title: Additional Resources:
sections.content: For additional practice and reinforcement, consider exploring examples in language learning books and online exercises.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.content: Thank you for joining today's lesson on 'In Case.' Practice using this expression confidently in various situations, and feel free to reach out if you have any questions. Happy learning!
